What is the name of a python package or library that can be used to implement an observer pattern

<|begin_of_text|>Q: What is the name of a python package or library that can be used to implement an observer pattern
A: The observer pattern is a software design pattern in which an object, called the subject, maintains a list of its dependents, called observers, and notifies them automatically of any state changes, usually by calling one of their methods. It is mainly used to implement distributed event handling systems, in "event driven" software. In those systems, the subject is usually named a "stream of events" or "stream source of events", while the observers are called "sinks of events". The stream nomenclature alludes to a physical setup where the observers are physically separated and have no control over the emitted events from the subject/stream-source. This pattern is essentially a combination of object-oriented inheritance, polymorphism and the delegation event model.<|end_of_text|>

Create a new thread and start it

my_thread.start()
Wait for the thread to finish
my_thread.join()

for week in cal:
    for day in week:
        print("%2d" % day, end=" ")
    print("")
